Title.evidence: This study evaluated whether pressure-controlled ventilation-volume guaranteed (PCV-VG) reduces intrapulmonary shunt (Qs/Qt) and ventilator-induced lung injury (VILI) in pediatric patients.

Trial_Design.evidence: Eighty children underwent thoracic surgery requiring OLV were randomly divided into PCV-VG group and volume-controlled ventilation (VCV) group.

Participants.evidence: Eighty children underwent thoracic surgery requiring OLV.

Intervention.evidence: The PCV-VG group utilized the PCV-VG during surgery, whereas the other group employed the VCV.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluated whether pressure-controlled ventilation-volume guaranteed (PCV-VG) reduces intrapulmonary shunt (Qs/Qt) and ventilator-induced lung injury (VILI) in pediatric patients.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome comprised the Qs/Qt fraction.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: randomly divided into PCV-VG group and volume-controlled ventilation (VCV) group.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Eighty children underwent thoracic surgery requiring OLV were randomly divided into PCV-VG group and volume-controlled ventilation (VCV) group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: lowered the incidence of PPCs [38.5 to 7.3%, adjusted odds ratio (OR) 0.13, 95% confidence interval (CI): 0.03–0.50, p = 0.001]

Harms.evidence: lowered the incidence of PPCs [38.5 to 7.3%, adjusted odds ratio (OR) 0.13, 95% confidence interval (CI): 0.03–0.50, p = 0.001]

Trial_Registration.evidence: Clinical trial registration: Clinicaltrials.gov , identifier ChiCTR2200065237.
